items.headline: ‘He constantly assures me that things are improving’: I feel betrayed by my husband’s financial misdeeds. How do I fix it?
items.summary_en: “He seems to think ‘bill due’ dates are a suggestion. He has literally no savings and lives paycheck to paycheck.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Dipping bond yields will boost growth stocks over value again, strategist says
items.summary_en: Growth stocks are the best place to be positioned in 2026 across all three markets, because bond yields, rather than earnings growth, is the key performance determinant, a strategist says.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: America is divided into two countries — Trump’s pro-billionaires and Mamdani’s anti-billionaires
items.summary_en: The 0.001% as an avatar for political polarization makes sense when you look at the world that tech billionaires have helped create.

items.headline: Marvell Technology stock is jumping. An M&A report is the trigger.
items.summary_en: Shares of Marvell Technology rallied in premarket trade on Thursday after a report that SoftBank considered buying the U.S. chipmaker in what would have been a record deal.

items.headline: OpenAI walks back comments about government support for its AI spending
items.summary_en: OpenAI’s CFO mentioned a potential government “backstop” for AI financing on Wednesday, but later said her choice of words “muddied the point.”

items.headline: My siblings don’t earn nearly as much as me. Should my parents leave me less money in their will?

items.headline: ‘Housing is extremely expensive’: My husband and I are building a house on my mother-in-law’s land. Are we asking for trouble?
items.summary_en: “A single-family home where we live costs $600,000 or more.”

items.headline: AMD just passed one test — but it’s not done yet
items.summary_en: Analysts are less focused on the latest earnings as AMD prepares to deliver long-term AI targets at next week’s analyst day.

items.headline: Robinhood doubles its revenue as customers flock to its prediction markets, other new businesses
items.summary_en: Robinhood reported third-quarter earnings late Wednesday, posting revenue that doubled year on year to $1.27 billion, and profit of 61 cents a share, up 259% compared with last year.

items.headline: Hailey Bieber’s Rhode brand was a huge win for Elf Beauty. Why the stock is losing a fifth of its value anyway.
items.summary_en: Elf Beauty surprised Wall Street with a weaker outlook and profit, sending the stock more than 25% lower.
